concept.title: Getting System Information
concept.shortdesc: N1QL has a system catalog that stores metadata about a database. The system catalog is a namespace called system.

conbody.p: There is a keyspace for each type of artifact. The keyspace names are plural in order to avoid conflicting with N1QL keywords.

li.p: Datastores are similar to sites. A datastore is a database deployment, for example, a server cluster, cloud service, or mobile installation. It is analogous to a relation database instance.
Namespaces are similar to pools. A namespace is a unit of authorization, resource allocation, and tenancy. It is analogous to a relational database or schema.
Keyspaces are similar to buckets. A keyspace is a set of documents that may vary in structure. It is a unit of authorization and resource allocation. It is analogous to a relational database table.
An index on a keyspace. It is analogous to a relational database index. Types of indexes include b-tree (ForestDB or MOI) and view indexes.
The dual keyspace has been added for evaluating constant expressions. It contains a single entry with no attributes.

section.title: Querying namespaces
section.p: You can query namespaces using the SELECT statement as follows:
The query returns the following attributes:

ul.li: store_id: string (id for the datastore to which the namespace belongs)

section.title: Querying keyspaces
section.p: You can query keyspaces using the SELECT statement as follows:
The query returns the following attributes:

ul.li: namespace_id: string (id for the namespace to which the keyspace belongs)
store_id: string (id for the datastore to which the keyspace belongs)

section.title: Querying indexes
section.p: You can query indexes using the SELECT statement as follows:
The query returns the following attributes:

ul.li: index_key: array of strings (list of index keys)
index_type: string (type of index, for example, view index)
keyspace_id: string (id for the keyspace to which the index belongs)
namespace_id: string (id for the namespace to which the index belongs)
store_id: string (id for the datastore to which the index belongs)

section.title: Querying dual
section.p: You can use dual to evaluate constant expressions.
The query returns the result of the expression, 7 in this case.
